sentences.en: A student will probably attend four or five courses during each semester.
sentences.cn: 每个学生一学期可能要修四五门课程.

sentences.en: All the local clergy were asked to attend the ceremony.
sentences.cn: 所有当地的圣职人员都获邀参加这项仪式。

sentences.en: All three are Chelsea fans, and attend all home games together.
sentences.cn: 3个人都是切尔西队的球迷，一起观看了所有的主场比赛。

sentences.en: All undergraduates reading English attend a turtorial group each week.
sentences.cn: 所有攻读英语的本科生每周上一次导师辅导课.

sentences.en: He didn't attend that meeting under the pretext of sickness.
sentences.cn: 他以生病为借口,没参加那个会议.

sentences.en: I take it as a pleasure to attend your lecture.
On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.cn: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

sentences.en: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.cn: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.en: She agreed to attend but jibbed at making a speech.
sentences.cn: 她同意出席但不愿发言。

sentences.en: Some people are unwilling to attend the classes partly because of the cost involved.
sentences.cn: 有些人不愿来上课，部分原因是所需的费用问题。

sentences.en: Stars including Joan Collins are expected to attend.
sentences.cn: 包括琼·柯林斯在内的明星们，届时预计会参加。

sentences.en: Syria will attend only if the negotiations deal with issues of substance.
sentences.cn: 只有在谈判涉及重大问题时叙利亚才会参加。

sentences.en: The Matron at the nursing home expressed a wish to attend.
sentences.cn: 养老院的护士长说她愿意参加。

sentences.en: the peculiar atmosphere which attends such an event
sentences.cn: 伴随这类事件的怪异气氛

sentences.en: The President left his sickbed to attend the ceremony.
sentences.cn: 总统带病去出席那个仪式。

sentences.en: Unfortunately, I won't be able to attend the meeting.
sentences.cn: 真可惜我不能参加这次会议。

sentences.en: We were made to attend meetings every day.
sentences.cn: 我们每天都得参加会议。

sentences.en: Will it be inconvenient for him to attend that meeting?
sentences.cn: 他参加那次会议会不方便 吗 ?

words.tran_cn: 出席者；按规定常到的人；常客

trans.tran_cn: 出席，参加，经常去（某地），看护，伴随，专心
trans.tran_en: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

trans.tran_cn: 注意， 倾听； 侍奉， 伴随； 专心于
trans.tran_en: to happen or exist at the same time as something
to go to an event such as a meeting or a class
